title: Bus Structures
subject: Computer Organization
theory:
Communication pathway. 
1. **Data Bus**: Bi-directional. Carries data. Width = Word size (e.g., 64-bit). 
2. **Address Bus**: Uni-directional (CPU -> Memory). Width determines RAM size (e.g., 32-bit = 4GB). 
3. **Control Bus**: Signals (Read/Write, Interrupt).

interview_questions.question: Why is Address Bus uni-directional?
interview_questions.answer: CPU addresses Memory/IO. Memory never addresses CPU.
